info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 11:19AM CDT until May 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Choctaw, Washington and Clarke Counties.
Tombigbee River Near Leroy affecting Clarke and Washington Counties.
For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Coffeeville Dam - Pool, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tombigbee River near Coffeeville Dam.
* WHEN...From this evening to Saturday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 26.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 30.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.3 feet on 02/21/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued when updates occur.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Choctaw, AL; Clarke, AL; Washington, AL
